it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards

Class TwoEffectWeapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards.Card
      • it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards.Weapon
        • it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.cards.TwoEffectWeapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseFightAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlternateFireWeapon, OneOptionalEffectWeapon

    public abstract class TwoEffectWeapon
extends Weapon
    The abstract class for the weapon with two effetcs, that could be both alternative or optional
    Author:
    Federico Innocente

    • Method Detail

      • setLoaded

        public void setLoaded()
        Set the weapon loaded. The lost of player damaged by the weapon is cleared
        Overrides:
        setLoaded in class Weapon

      • isUsableEffectTwo

        public boolean isUsableEffectTwo()
        Check if the second effect is usable in the current condition. That means that teh effect must be enabled, the player can pay for it and that it has targets in range.
        Returns:
        true if the effect can be performed, false otherwise

      • getTargetEffectTwo

        public abstract ControllerViewEvent getTargetEffectTwo()
        Calculate all the possible targets of the second effect (which could be squares or players) and encode them into a message ready to be send to the player .
        Returns:
        a message with all teh information about teh possible targets

      • performEffectTwo

        public abstract void performEffectTwo(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> targets)
        Perform the second effect of the weapon
        Parameters:
        targets - are the targets chosen by the player

      • performEffect

        public void performEffect(int selectedEffect,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Object> targets)
        Method called to perform an effect. It can preform only an effect that is enabled for that weapon, otherwise throw an exception
        Overrides:
        performEffect in class Weapon
        Parameters:
        selectedEffect - is the selected effect
        targets - are the targets of the effect, that could be character o square alternatively (depends of the effect)

      • getTargetEffect

        public ControllerViewEvent getTargetEffect(int selectedEffect)
        Get all the possible target of the effect, which could be both squares or players, and return a message ready to be send to the clients for the choice. Only effects enabled for the weapons can be requested.
        Overrides:
        getTargetEffect in class Weapon
        Parameters:
        selectedEffect - is the effect which targets are requested
        Returns:
        a message with the information about all possible targets of the effetc

      • isUsableEffect

        public boolean isUsableEffect(int selectedEffect)
        Check if an effect can be correctly used. That means that teh effect must be enabled, the player can pay for it and that it has targets in range. Only enabled effects can be checked
        Overrides:
        isUsableEffect in class Weapon
        Parameters:
        selectedEffect - is the selected effect
        Returns:
        true if the effect is usable, false otherwise

      • hasToPay

        public boolean hasToPay(int effect)
        Check if an effect has to be payed or less. That's because some effects can be performed on more steps, but has to payed ust once
        Overrides:
        hasToPay in class Weapon
        Parameters:
        effect - is the checked effect
        Returns:
        true if the effect has to be payed, false otherwise

      • getEffectCost

        public AmmoCube[] getEffectCost(int effect)
        Get the cost of an effect. Only enabled effect can have a cost
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
